column4: I think I have a problem with the command sudo apt-get update.when I run it,it won't stop.
it seems that it always get the same thing,but never hit,so he always try to do the same thing without result.
this is what it looks like on the screen: Get:1312 http://ubuntu.cn99.com jaunty/restricted Packages [8848B]
any one can help?
you possibly added that cn99.com site as a package source
is there any problem with the source cn99.com
if apt-get update or update manager is hanging there, then maybe
maybe there could be a problem with taht
I'll change a source sever
pastebin the output of this in a terminal:  sudo apt-get update
pastebin the output of this in a terminal????
run the command in a terminal then copy it all into a pastebin at the url here: http://paste.ubuntu.com
go to System -> Administration -> Software Sources
then click on the updown arrows to the right of "Download from:"
still there?
after clicking on the updown arrows, click on Other
are you at that step?
are you in Software Sources?
sorry,
click on the "Select Best Server" button
good to hear! :)
